div.head: ¶ A godly prayer, very needefull to be vsed and sayde, before any Iorney be taken in hand.
div.p:
O Lorde Iesus Christe, with thy almightie euerlasting & heauenly Father, in vnitie with the holy Ghost, very trwe and euerliuinge God, as thou diddest leade the children of Israell out of the lande of Egipt, into the lande of Promise, through the vnfrequented Wildernesse, in great safetie, in the daye tyme by a Cloude, and in the darke night by a Firy Piller: Euen thou O Lorde, which dyddest guyde the Wyse men from the rysing of the Sunne vnto Bethlem, and home againe into their owne countrie by a Starre, preseruinge them from all hurtes and daungers. So likewise, O heauenly Father, I most humbly desire thee, that in this my Iourney, thou wilt be my guide and protectour, that I may accomplish and bring this my way to an ende, in health, and gladnesse: Preserue and kéepe me from all
perills of Soule and body, so that by thy fatherly protection, I may ouercome all perills and daungers, through Iesus Christ thyne onely welbeloued sonne our Lord and Sauiour. Amen.
